pr_title: [CB-8188] Add Medium Duty HA Entitlement enforcement

timeline.author: frozenwizard

timeline.bodyText: Yea this doesn't need to be part of the response.  Remove it for the other files.
timeline.author: frozenwizard
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -18,7 +18,8 @@ public SdxClusterDetailResponse(SdxClusterResponse sdxClusterResponse, StackV4Re

                 sdxClusterResponse.getClusterShape(), sdxClusterResponse.getCloudStorageBaseLocation(),

timeline.message: [CB-8188] Added medium duty ha entitlement capabilities and tests to SDX cluster creation logic

timeline.bodyText: I don't understand why we need this? Shouldn't you just check if the cluster shape is Medium Duty?
timeline.author: kmanamcheri

timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't this check if the cluster shape requested is medium duty? If it is, then you validate that you have the entitlement.
timeline.author: kmanamcheri

timeline.bodyText: Remove all changes in this file.  As discussed, the SdxClusterShape says whether or not it is light, custom or medium.
timeline.author: frozenwizard

timeline.bodyText: Here compare the sdxClusterRequest.sdxclustershape to SDXClusterShape.MEDIUM_DUTY_HA

timeline.bodyText:
Improve this error message to state what entitlement should be enabled.
"Provisioning a medium duty data lake cluster is not enabled for this account. Contact Cloudera support to enable CDP_MEDIUM_DUTY_SDX entitlement for the account"
